title: Memory Day Uprising
outcome: A city-wide "Memory Day" is declared, halting all BCI scoring and daily business. Citizens share untold experiences and review the city's history together. Collective refusal to return to the BCI marks a turning point, as communities reclaim their moral agency and reject automated rule.

events.description: A grassroots coalition calls for a citywide 'Memory Day,' urging suspension of all BCI scoring and official activity for reflection and healing.
Crowds gather daily in major squares to share personal accounts of BCI harms, Halden myths, and hopes for a new future. Public storytelling replaces propaganda.
Oksana Lintz helps organize an assembly where citizens rewrite Stenograd's community guidelines without reference to the BCI or old Council mandates.
A spontaneous citywide vote rejects reinstating the BCI, forcing the Council to confront a populace unwilling to accept automated governance.
The Council attempts to restore BCI scoring, but people across Stenograd refuse to participate, marking the city's decisive break from machine rule.
